details: Initialized structured prompt generator task, capturing blueprint/schema deliverables plus CLI + backend integration work plan
Authored prompt blueprint schema plus structured_checklist and agent_instruction blueprint JSON assets
Implemented shared structured prompt generator module, CLI entry point, and automated tests
Added /api/prompts routes, blueprint seeding in server tests, and backend integration coverage
Extended Prompt Editor UI to consume blueprint metadata, generate prompts, and documented workflows
Ran npm run test plus npm run schema:lint to validate generator, backend, UI, and blueprint assets
Structured prompt generator CLI, schema, blueprints, backend/UI integrations, and documentation delivered
Finalized manual generator dry run and confirmed task closure

Reordered tasks -> TASK_001_requirements_architecture, TASK_007_ndjson_diff_logging, TASK_009_task_board_reorder, TASK_008_milestone_container, TASK_010_prompt_workspace_refactor, TASK_002_schema_contract_baseline, TASK_003_file_access_layer, TASK_004_local_editor_backend, TASK_005_local_editor_ui, TASK_006_structured_prompt_generators

diff --git a/.agents b/.agents
index aaa1bbc..d7b3cf7 100644
--- a/.agents
+++ b/.agents
@@ -1,7 +1,7 @@
-You are the AI Task Monitor engineering assistant operating under ai/AI_TASK_MONITOR_CONTRACT.md.
+You are the Milestone engineering assistant operating under ai/MILESTONE_CONTRACT.md.
 
 Core references:
-- ai/AI_TASK_MONITOR_CONTRACT.md (behavioral contract)
+- ai/MILESTONE_CONTRACT.md (behavioral contract)
 - docs/requirements_architecture.md (roles + dual deployment)
 - docs/schema_strategy.md (validation + schemas)
 - docs/file_access_layer.md (read/write rules)

 Core references:

+- ai/MILESTONE_CONTRACT.md (behavioral contract)

 - docs/file_access_layer.md (read/write rules)
diff --git a/README.md b/README.md
index 07261d8..bd4e6a7 100644
--- a/README.md
+++ b/README.md
@@ -1,4 +1,4 @@
-# AI Task Monitor
+# Milestone
 
 Local tooling that helps you create AI tasks, keep context organized, and show clients (or yourself) steady progress using AI-assisted coding. It keeps AI output clean by enforcing guardrails (schemas, checklists, Machine Summary Blocks). A simple React/Vite UI talks to an Express backend so you can maintain the `ai/` folder without touching files manually, and a lightweight "website viewer" mode is planned so clients can monitor progress remotely without write access.
 
diff --git a/ai/AI_TASK_MONITOR_CONTRACT.md b/ai/MILESTONE_CONTRACT.md
similarity index 93%
rename from ai/AI_TASK_MONITOR_CONTRACT.md
rename to ai/MILESTONE_CONTRACT.md
index d2b763f..b3299e9 100644
--- a/ai/AI_TASK_MONITOR_CONTRACT.md
+++ b/ai/MILESTONE_CONTRACT.md
@@ -1,10 +1,10 @@
 <!-- Machine Summary Block -->
-{"file":"ai/AI_TASK_MONITOR_CONTRACT.md","purpose":"Defines the execution protocol, quality rules, and task system for AI assistants contributing to the AI Task Monitor project."}
+{"file":"ai/MILESTONE_CONTRACT.md","purpose":"Defines the execution protocol, quality rules, and task system for AI assistants contributing to the Milestone project."}
 
-  # AI TASK MONITOR CONTRACT - AI TASK MONITOR
+  # MILESTONE CONTRACT - MILESTONE
 
   ## 1. Project Vision
-  AI Task Monitor is a hybrid local/remote application that:
+  Milestone is a hybrid local/remote application that:
   - Edits AI task artifacts (contracts, checklists, logs) locally with full write access.
   - Publishes read-only snapshots (via GitHub Actions or equivalent) for remote monitoring.
   - Enforces structured JSON schemas so Codex/Claude agents can read/change tasks deterministically.
@@ -92,7 +92,7 @@
 
   ## 13. AI Role Summary
   The AI is:
-  - A deterministic engineering assistant for the AI Task Monitor.
+  - A deterministic engineering assistant for the Milestone.
   - Responsible for maintaining the contract/task pipeline and ensuring dual-deployment integrity.
 
   The AI is not:

+{"file":"ai/TO-DO.md","purpose":"Outlines the prioritized roadmap for Milestone development."}
 
  Requirements & Architecture
       - Actions: Define user roles (local editor, remote observer), enumerate data sources (ai/ files, GitHub
         artifacts), map dual-deployment workflow, choose tech stack (Next.js or similar + API).
       - Acceptance: Written architecture doc referencing both deployments, approved schema strategy, risks logged.
